categories.title: Fable
categories.preview: Imitation and variation of Aesop through expansion, abbreviation, and direct discourse

categories.title: Narrative
categories.preview: Foundational retelling excercises reversing, reordering, and building toward full narratio

categories.title: Chreia
categories.preview: Concise anecdote of a saying or deed, composed for instruction

categories.title: Proverb
categories.preview: Amplification of anonymous moral sayings in the manner of the chreia

categories.title: Refutation
categories.preview: Critique of myths or arguments, paired with confirmation to train both sides of debate

categories.title: Confirmation
categories.preview: Defense of a view or story by proving its credibility

categories.title: Commonplace
categories.preview: General amplification of virtues or vices, preparing for encomium and vituperation

categories.title: Encomium
categories.preview: Exposition of virtues in praise of a person, thing, time, place, or idea

categories.title: Vituperation
categories.preview: Exposition of faults in blame of a person, thing, time, place, or idea

categories.title: Comparison
categories.preview: Juxtaposition of subjects in praise or blame to heighten effect

categories.title: Impersonation
categories.preview: Dramatic imitation of a character's voice through direct speech

categories.title: Description
categories.preview: Vivid portrayel of a subject so it stands before the eyes

categories.title: Thesis
categories.preview: General argument on a question, examining both sides without specific application

categories.title: Defend / Attack a Law
categories.preview: Argument for or against a specific law, applying thesis methods to a concrete case
